review: We stopped by after some Christmas shopping. Service was decent and food was tasty. Im a potato freak so the bottomless fries really tickled my fancy. I would definitely return for the A1 burger!

Went to try the 6.99 bacon chzburger. Good value with the bottomless fries. Bill was 10 something with a ice tea. Good promotion for right now. But the server was not very attentive especially being at 2 in the afternoon, they were not busy, but she was visiting with friends who had a new baby there. Looks like they were co workers that were too busy socializing than taking care of the patrons. Would give it more stars but service was not too good. A bar tender is supposed to be working the bar area, not in the other side of the wall chatting with friends and discussing breastfeeding. I could have done with out all the gestures about milking.
Good food! I always make my own burger and they're always patient with me! Great customer service.

I tried Red Robin today. I've heard a few people say the place was pretty good. I wasn't too impressed. With including "gourmet burger" after their name, I wasn't wowed with the burger. Maybe I just needed to order one of the burgers with more ingredients on it. I had a double cheeseburger and I was expecting a large juicy burger but the burger consisted of two thin patties. The meat seemed like it was coarsely ground also. The texture wasn't very good. I did enjoy the bottomless steak fries and our server was fairly attentive. The bill for wife and two young kids without tip was $30. Next time I may just drive south on LaGrange and stop in Denny's for a doubly cheeseburger at least I would get my hands greasy. I really was hoping to be impressed but wasn't.
Loved this place...Drinks  were  very good... The burger was also very very good especially for a chain...We have to go down that way again in a few weeks & I am defiantly going back again...

Took my family for lunch.  It's a noisy, sports bar type atmosphere with the requisite TVs showing sporting events.  Staff was friendly  Service was good.  Lots to choose from on the menu and good things on the kids menu. My grandkids ate all their food.  Two daughters ordered Margaritas but were served something that was not a Margarita.  The server promptly replaced them.  I've had several different burgers in the past and enjoyed them all.  They have always been cooked to my specifications.  This day I had the Burning Love, a hot and spicy burger.  Quite good.  The unlimited steak fries are good and a nice change from the usual fries. Refills on drinks were kept coming without asking.  One of my grandkids turned one that day and they sang to her and presented her with an ice cream sundae, from which she immediately grabbed a handful of whipped cream.  Cute.  Other than the noise level, it was a pleasant dining experience.
Now I know why I haven't been here in 2 years.....service extremely slow, burger cooked wrong while not served hot and on a stale bun.  Never again will I be back.

I finally ate at Red Robin...yummy! The burgers are big, the service is great, and the atmosphere is fun.  It reminded me of a Portillo's with waitress service.  The prices are a little on the high side for standard burger fare, but if you eat in, your dinner includes "bottomless fries." Also, there are free refills on most non-alcoholic beverages.  I had the avocado  bacon burger, which was delicious. I also tried the raspberry limeade, which had been recommended by a friend.  Very refreshing, and yes, I took advantage of those free refills!   This is a family-friendly place, not so much the sort of restaurant that is conducive to lingering and catching up with someone over a long conversation.  I don't mean to imply they rush you out--they don't--but be prepared for a busy restaurant with a moderately high noise level.  It is also very clean.

I took my fiance here for her surprise birthday party last Saturday We hadn't been here for months, and we always like the bar & grill atmosphere that Red Robin presents... Plus, they have "Never Ending Fries" (def.: they are "Never Ending" only if you ask for more.  They won't refill your baskets like they do your soft drinks) So we came with a party of 14.  The wait was pretty short for that amount of people. But we sat down and ordered the cheese sticks (which are great).  One other person ordered the pretzel bites, which were really good too. For our entree, I ordered the Oktoberfest Burger (ham, Swiss cheese, sauteed onions, on a pretzel bun)...The Girl got a Spicy Chicken sandwich plain The food came out and I devoured it like a vacuum sucks dirt.  Probably because I had eaten NO MEAT for that entire week...and I was feeling less than a man. My friend had ordered an Oktoberfest burger as well, though he wanted it with no onion.  One thing that I have noticed in the past about this particular Red Robin is that if you order an item, and change it in any way...they usually fudge it up ...and they did.  First it was brought out with the onion...then without the ham, which negated the whole specialty burger idea.  He was upset...but I was fine! :-) Like my last review for Cracker Barrel, they also did they whole Birthday Song and desert deal as well...it was fantastic! At the end, our waiter seemed to forget a few of the bills.  Not mine!  We separated ours from the rest of the group (tip coming up) It was a good time.  The atmosphere is great, but I've had a better burger and fries at Five Guys.  Still a nice place to go, and OH BY THE WAY, their sweet potato fries are really good! ...and A LOT BETTER than that Purple Onion garbage dump!

Finally went there after the illuminati's saturation of subliminal messages over the televison airwaves to visit the place. Kid (perternity test pending) and wifey had Tavern burger and I had some type of spicy-pineapply-hot pepper-double patty nonsense. Pattys were tender and well seasoned. Fries were unlimited, so I essentially could have ordered water and fries. Nevertheless, better than expected. Servicewasreally good. Waitress was a chubby/chatty gal...like, I get it. You want me. Let me eat yo. 3 out of 5 penis'. Just came back from Dicks Sporting Goods.

Overpriced, greasy food. I started with french onion soup. It was so salty i could not finish it.  then i got wings and chips... The wings were on top of the chips, making them soggy.  service was actually great, but food was subpar and not worth the price nor calories.

$16 for a tasteless cheeseburger and hard flat warm, not hot fries, I guess that's what they call them!  No frills, no pickle wedge, nothing.  They pile everything on the burger for you then stuff it in a wrapper and by the time you get it, it is barely warm, soggy and messy. I was so mad at myself for wasting my $$$ and my shopping time.  I keep trying to figure out why I would ever go back and all I can think of is there is no reason whatsoever.  There is nothing memorable about Red Robin, sorry, I really don't usually complain, but these establishments need to come up with something unique for their restaurant that makes a consumer want to come back.  Most of them don't! REd Robin certainly didn't.

We won't be back.  Poor service -  never got my drink and our waitress never checked back with us to see if we needed anything.  I tried their original burger - I thought it was average.  2 burgers, 2 fries, 1 soda $26.00.

Red Robin is well, Red Robin.  Went there for lunch with my daughters and mother one weekday afternoon.  My daughter accidentally cut her toe (badly) on the front door.  Totally an accident, and her fault.  The manager was so helpful and kind that she attended to her injury right away.  Although they did not have a first-aid kit on hand (which would have been better than a bunch of napkins), she was VERY concerned, checked on her several times, and gave us our entire meal for free.  They did not have to do that... and it was a very kind gesture.

We used to go here all the time because the burgers were great and the kids loved it. The last two times we've been there the service was awful...and I mean awful. Slow, forgetful, totally uninterested. Further, the food is slipping downhill massively. The fries used to be really delicious and crispy and now they're soggy and not flavorful. You have to ask them to almost burn them to get them decent. I don't remember what happened exactly that was the straw that broke the camel's back the last time we were there, but my husband paid the bill, stood up and said "we're never eating here again. Ever." And we haven't been back since. If you're looking for a similar place with decent service go for Chili's instead.

I've never been disappointed coming to eat here. The service is always excellent (this means that the waiter pays attention and makes sure we have everything we need including all the refills on our empty drinks). Absolutely love the bottomless fries. My favorite is the mushroom pepperjack cheese burger. I recently tried the jalapeno bun and couldn't really taste the spice. I'll have to try another bread the next time. Sign up for their rewards program and you'll get a free burger on your birthday month!

this place never disappoints for A GREAT DELICIOUS BACON CHEESEBURGER.. They are always polite and friendly, which is the type of service you should expect. I have no complaints about this place and hey its better then McDonalds....at least their burgers look like meat..
Great customer service, great food. Their burgers are always amazing regardless of the type of burger you order. Bottomless fries is a plus. Red robin burgers are one of my favorites!

If you want to gain weight, This is the place to go.  They serve fried everything, milkshakes and ice cream sundaes.  Every time I have been here I get sick.  My stomach can't handle all the grease.  I get sick just looking at all the grease everyone else is eating.  They serve a huge tower of fried onion rings. They serve bottomless plank style french fries.  Plus, a myriad of fried appetizers.  Then there's the sugary drinks that come in beautiful glasses.  The burgers are garnished with so much more calories.  You will pay an average of $10 a burger! They even have a Big Mac copykat with more calories than McDonald's. You can expect to pay nearly $100 for a family of 5.  The kids menu is for children 10 and under! If your 11yr. old child wants chicken tenders, you will have to pay over $10 from the adult menu, which only come with french fries! The tenders are your typical frozen, extra batter, fast food tenders you can purchase anywhere else for half the price! I'm sorry, but no more Red Robin for me.

While in town visiting my folks for Christmas and shopping at the mall, my son & I decided to grab a burger from a place we know is good. Just a note, we needed a quick place to get in, order, eat & get out in a decent amount of time so we could meet family near by. Service was quick and friendly. It was snowing and cold, so I dropped my son off so that he could grab a table. He walked in and was seated right away. Parked, walked in and my drink was already on the table. Ordered with in a few minutes and food was served quickly. Fries were hot. Burgers were cooked the way we like (med/rare, the location in The Woodlands, TX refuses to cook med/rare). Manager stopped by our table to check on us. Restrooms were clean and well kept. Bottom line: Quick & friendly service. Food served to our specs and hot. Location clean and orderly. Will visit again.

It was a snowy and miserable day for driving. But we had to make our weekly trip to Trader Joe's or we'd be ordering Chinese food and pizza all week.  As we made our way there, we decided to get lunch at Red Robin. This was my first time at Red Robin and my boyfriend only recalled trying it once, a very long long time ago. He remembered ordered food at a counter and sitting down. Not a place with full waiter service. We were both surprised that it was a full out restaurant. But sat down anyways and ordered some burgers. Both of us wanted a cheaper place but neither regretted this choice. The burgers were great! I got the mushroom swiss burger (my favorite across the board) and my boyfriend got the chili chili burger. Because of the horrid weather, there were few other customers around so we got excellent service and a very friendly waitress.  The steak fries were wonderful. I enjoyed them and we even got a second order of them (since they were bottomless and free). Overall, we would definitely come back again when we have a taste for a burger. I liked the food far better than a Five Guys burger (which is way too greasy) in my opinion.
The server was great!  Even took the time to make my two year old feel special.  Food was cooked just right.... and lets face it... it is great on the budget.

I dont come to Red Robbin very often but when I do it is always enjoyable... Until now. Let me take you for a ride down this dark visit. Let's start off with this. Normally in my previous visits we got frys right off the bat and normally got  two or three new baskets before the food arrived. Not this time. We didn't get a single order of frys until our food arrived. Now just step back and think about that. That's like going to Olive Garden and them not giving you bread sticks until your food arrives. I ordered the rib tips & Mac and cheese. A few visits ago their Mac and cheese was great so I figured I would try it again. This proved to be a terrible choice. The cheese on top was melted but the middle was still cold once the cheese was removed. No biggie, things happen. They replaced the Mac and cheese. Now for the rib tips. They were honestly 95% bone and 5% meat. I couldn't get any meat off of them. Overall: I would come back, just never order the riblets & Mac and cheese again. Also, things happen. Looking forward to possibly hearing from corporate about this. Not because I want something free, just to give them feedback about the quality of what I ordered.

Poor service, under cooked food and dirty plates.  There are so many better places in the area that want your business.   Our server tried to push my drink selection when I said I would prefer something else.  She said that I would like it once I got used to it.  Ultimately she brought me something else.  She forgot the ranch for my daughter's chicken tenders and forgot my Splenda sweetener.  She had to be reminded for both.  I get it, no big deal.  However, she forgot to ask if we wanted refills on our bottomless drinks or if we wanted anything else before bringing us our check. As for my burger, it came to me mooing.  This isn't how a medium burger should look.  I was exhausted and didn't think to bring management's attention to the issue.  Then half way through eating my burger, I noticed that my plate was dirty on the side.   It all kind of dawned on me when I got home what a marginal experience I had had.  I e-mailed RR management that night.  When I didn't here back after a few days I e-mailed them back again.  I then received a call from a grumpy sounding manager, John.  He mentioned that he hadn't heard from corporate until that day.  John didn't seem genuinely interested in my poor experience.  Just the same he said he wanted to mail me a gift card.  Well, one week went by and no gift card.   I e-mailed RR management one more time to tell them that I was going to post something on Yelp.  The GM then contacted me.  At this point I wasn't interested.  Why should it take two weeks to address a poor experience. If you want excellent food and good customer service go down the street to Rock Bottom Brewery.

I've been here twice so far and I intend on coming back again.  The first time I came I had the Whiskey River BBQ burger, which I thought was great until the second time I came here, when I ordered the Burnin' Love burger, and that's gotta be one of the best burgers I've ever tasted. I was worried it was going to be too spicy, but it's mild (and not in a bad way, for those that are partial to really spicy foods). Lot of rich flavor in every bite. The salsa is great and so is the jalapeno roll that they use.  They also have a bunch of sauces you could ask for to use with your bottomless fries. I'd highly suggest trying thai chili and tavern. Chipotle is good too, but you can get that anywhere.  Come to Red Robin if you want to enjoy some high quality (and moderately priced) food in a lively atmosphere.
The hamburgers excellent. Had the bacon avocado !!! I do have to agree with others the Svc is slow. In Cali yu had yur fries as soon as yu sat down.

Red Robin is a bit over priced but I gave always gotten good service here, the food is decent. On my latest visit I had the Whiskey river bbq chicken sandwich which was surprisingly good.  Over priced,  but not bad.

On a Saturday around 6 o'clock its hard trying to find a place to eat with a short wait.  This past saturday we went to 3 different places before we came to Red Robbin and we were glad we did.  The place was packed but only a 35 min wait... not too bad, compared to the 2 hour waits we were told by other places...  But you know, besides the food being great, our waiter was awesome.  He was sooo busy but not once did he forget about us. He was happy and friendly, and overall looked like he enjoyed his job... .all awhile he was serving 5 other tables he looked well organized and gave good service! Thanks Scottie for your help!  And the food is great! Get the onion rings to start, chicken tortilla soup and a whisky bbq burger!! Excellent.

Took my mom here for Mother's Day yesterday. Everything was really good. My mom enjoyed herself. I had the Ensenada platter, delicious! The service is very nice and there was a manager visible & checking that everything was running smooth. Only one weird thing which may be self explanatory, but still odd, the hostess greeted me with, "Hi! How many & Are you both over 21?" It was weird because I thought they trying to say they were out of booths and tables and trying to seat us at the bar-- which they didn't but...Just interesting. Other than that, everything was great! Will be back.

This place used to be amazing! Fresh food, fast service, friendly staff.  That is no longer the case, I will tell the story of our experience this afternoon.  We came to Red Robin for some lunch with friends, upon entering we weren't greeted properly (No 'hello' or welcome to 'Red Robin'.) the hostess just pointed us to a table without a smile and we sat down. About five minutes later we finally saw our waitress, we ordered drinks and after the drinks were brought to the table we noticed two of them were only half full!  So, we order and appetizer and there are no sauces to be found on the appetizer, so I flag over the girl that brought us the appetizer and ask for sauce. She never comes back, fifteen minutes later I see our waitress again and ask her for the sauce that we asked for. . . she finally brings it and drops it on the table just to run off again when we all needed refills.  So we all got our entrees, the food was cold and mediocre at best.  My bun was stale and my sandwich was tasteless. . . the fries were ice cold.  NONE of us were satisfied and I highly doubt any of us will come back. Edit: 5/7/16 This establishment has really improved since I wrote the above negative review some years back, the past few times I've been there my food has been fresh and the service has been wonderful.  I really love Red Robin and I am glad that the Orland Store has improved!

They promptly contacted me and were very nice and understanding. Daina offered her apologies and listened to everything i has to say and has offered me compensation because of it. Thank You for being kind and understanding and hearing out your customers and dealing with issues promptly. I'll defiantly continue going to Red Robin.

Took the family here on a week night after a little league baseball game hoping for a quick, decent dinner.  After waiting 15 min to order our lemonades & water we finally were able to track down the bus boy to clean off our table as our arms were sticking to it.   The place was a complete mess with tables next to us not being cleaned off the entire time we were there.  Of course the floor was littered with bottomless fries that never made it to their final destination.   The people next to us were writhing waiting for their drinks after 20 min.   Chick Fil-A is across the parking lot and will be our restaurant of choice when we need a chicken fix.  I can't believe we stayed.

Today I got the Collossus burger. Not a bad tasting burger. But, it is nothing like it looks in the pictures. There was maybe between a teaspoon to a tablespoon of brisket on it. The brisket really didn't add anything. If it wasn't there and it was just bbq sauce I wouldn't have noticed a difference. To me it seems Red Robin has taken a step back since they opened at this location. They give you your fries in these little metal rings. All that does is limit how much fries are in my basket and looks tacky. Come on I'm an adult give me more tgan just a few fries. And, today the food took a really long time. I counted a half hour from ordering to food hitting the table. Either way still not a bad location and the is decent.

Solid specialty burgers in a kid friendly atmosphere. The blazing burger is great for spicy lovers, and I recommend the $.99 for the garlic Parmesan fries. Service is usually friendly but this location is usually swamped so it can take a few extra mins for the basics (refills, check).

Found hair in my food (3 different times!). Once was a fantastic place to take the family - now they are getting cheap on the amount of food you get. Service has gone down hill. The "managers" said sorry but did not offer anything else to keep us coming back. Tables we dirty, need to bring your bleach to sit down at their tables. I've heard people getting sick after going to this location. Edit: this management "team" thinks they work for some 5-star restaurant bringing in $200 checks per table - got news for you, you're NOT!

This place is going down the tubes. The place was very dirty. None of the tables were bussed. The hostess tried to seat us at a dirty table and couldn't understand why we wouldn't sit down at it. The waitress Hannah couldn't tell my daughter if they had lo-cal dressings for the salad. We had to look it up online and inform her. This will be our last visit to this location!

Literally waited 20 minutes after we were sat to get our drink orders. Completely ignored by all the waiters as they walked right by. I think their strategy to making their burgers taste better is by starving you first. I should probably bring a snack next time to tide me over.  Our food finally made it's way to our table 25 minutes after that. So 45 minutes in, we're tasting the burgers we ordered. Disappointment. All our burgers and fries were really greasy. You can see a bucket of grease ooze out as you cut into the burger and a puddle of grease under my garlic fries. $13.49 for "Gourmet Burger". More like soggy burger. I was expecting a little more.  My sister-in-law ordered Mac and Cheese as a side to her burger. Said it tasted like it came out of a bag. Well.. Hehe. It did. My wife confirmed as she spotted them making it.. Microwaved in a bag, shook it up and dumped it in a bowl. First time at Red Robins and may be the last. I might give another location a try but... Meh. I just created this account to write this review. I've always thought about creating one to write praises and positive reviews on countless restaurants that my wife and I visit. We eat out almost everyday. We travel a lot as well. Sad to say that Red Robins had to be our first review. It's just too bad to go unnoticed :(

I tried bringing my kids here today.  When the hostess brought us to the table, I asked her if it had been cleaned because there was a paper straw wrapper sticking out of the booth side. She said " oh, I can  wipe it" ( isn't that supposed to be done before we get seate?) So she left to get something to clean.  I looked further at the dirty table, filthy floor all around and grease marks and food debris hanging off the chair! We bailed out of there before she could make it back.  I'm terrified to know what's going on in that kitchen! This place is discusting

I should have listened to the reviews. This place is really nothing special. My burger was average and the appetizers ordered (chips & guacamole and chicken wings) were extremely small. There were 3 people in my group and we had no idea we would only get one wing each and only a small container of guacamole which tasted awful.  I wouldn't recommend coming here, but I did find the workers pleasant at least.

I have eaten at another location, although it has been a while. That experience was fine. This location was not good. It was pretty dirty. The food was just OK. Not sure about these bottomless fries. We got a very small portion with our order and that was it. Maybe I don't understand what bottomless fries means. Then I went to the restroom. It was only somewhat clean. No seat covers in any stall. I had to change my baby. The changing station was in the handicap stall. The lock did not work. And the baby changing station itself was not clean. That did it for me. On top of all of this, our server didn't even smile at us. Will not be returning. Too many other options in Orland Park.

Red Robin in Orland Park is always busy. They have great burger with reasonable price. I really love their French Fries, taste awesome but I couldn't never finish them all. I will definitely go back for more burger. What can I say, girl loves her meat....haha.

First time eating at red robins and had a great time with my family we did kind of waited a bit of a long time before sitting and gettin our food to our table the waitress was nice we order some wings as our appetizer and I really liked them I'm a very picky at eating wings but this ones were really good for my personal opinion later when we got our burgers I expected to have something better atleast for the first time eating there than from the time we order for take out but anyways i might come back some other time  or go to a different location closer to where I live and wat of a difference of taste there might be

Dirty dirty dirty. Manager should be fired!   We should have left but my 8 year old wanted to go.  Only edible item was the double stack burger. It was to die for. Small enough meal so u can have dessert too.  Even the bathroom soap dispenser was dirty. My wife had diarrhea when we got home.  Made sure i paid by credit card so i can dispute it.

The burgers are so good here. One of my favorites . I like the fries with the optional garlic seasoning. And you can ask for more ... Servers always friendly. Very casual and usually quick with food after you order.  Very consistent

Nastiest place i've been in a while. The bar was greasy and sticky, plates were dirty, the bartender was working all over the place, so ordering stuff was difficult because we had to wait 10 minutes just to ask for something. Other employee was taking out the trash in the middle of the bar, but the way he was doing it, was by taking trash out of one trash bin and putting stuff in another one by hand, it looked nasty and unsanitary. Bathrooms were very dirty, and the floor in the restaurant was slipery and full of trash.

I came here with a couple friends before heading to the movies.  I haven't been here in years and I'm not sure why because the food was great.  The waitress was a little... interesting.  When we sat down she told us she was thankful we weren't slobs because everyone she had today was disgusting. Thanks...?  Anyways, the food was excellent.  I order the banzai burger and it was soo good.  I'm a sucker for anything with pineapple and just loved it.  I'm not sure if they take reservations, but if they do you should make them or be prepared to wait.  Luckily, we were running late so our friends were the ones that waited for the table (haha) so I can't say how long they waited.  Looks like many other yelpers had problems but I thought it was an ok place.
Enjoy eating here. Food has always been great, no complaints there. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Will continue to visit here.

My Faith in Red Robin has been completely restored. It doesn't take much at all  to restore my faith after several consecutive bad experiences at other locations The burger are very good if they are prepared right and mine was perfect. Fries were good. This time every thing was delicious and there was no excess grease sitting around as I have found in the past.  Our server, was very busy and seemed a bit "frazzled" Although she was bending, she never broke and was friendly and helpful and did a great job with us I am hoping that this trend will continue on our next visit.

Visited on 02/20/2015.  Prime Rib Dip very good.  Salad with Blue Cheese very good.  Skinny Spiked Sweet Tea very good.   Good Service from Jontel.   Two problems ruined the experience:  1)  New walls/partitions were added to separate each section, but now the noise has gotten louder. 2)  Customers with loud children, not controlling them, and just loitering around long after they stopped ordering.  We noticed a group with children that looked like they were leaving when we arrived around 8:50pm, and they just hung around talking loud, not controlling their children, and not ordering anything, like they had no heated home to go home to.   We left at  9:58pm, and they were still there.  You be the judge. Not sure if we are going back because we like the food, but we cannot stand dining with uncontrolled children.

My boyfriend and I decided to come here on a Sunday night a few months back after going to see a movie. The place itself wasn't too busy but it was probably the longest wait for food and drinks I've ever experienced. We were seated fairly quickly and the waitress had taken our drink order, my boyfriend ordered a milkshake that had alcohol in it (I can't remember the name) but waitress could not figure out how old he was as he has an Indiana ID, so she had to go check with the manager which took a good 10 minutes. Finally my boyfriend got the okay and about another 15 minutes later we got our drinks from a bus boy, but he didn't give a straw for my soda and when we tried to flag someone down for a straw we were ignored. Eventually, the waitress finally came and took our order, in the meantime my mom was calling and wanted us to get home since it was getting late, but we still didn't have our food. So 30 minutes later our food got to the table and we had to take it to go.   Overall, this is my first and last time I will be going to Red Robin.

Great service, food was eeeehhhhhh, quality below average, bacon had the taste that reminded you that it was a dirty nasty big pig you were eating not just yummy tasting piece of bacon, sweet potato fries extra greasy for an extra $1.49 on top of a an already $10+ expensive wrap. (Small portion for that price)  $2.79 for a glass of tea and lemonade. $36 for that and a salad with tip!   I've had the burgers here before and I likened them to a bland bloody sponge.  Now I love a good burger but the quality is just not here!  Just because you call it gourmet doesn't make it gourmet.  Gourmet connotes "high quality excellent food".   The food served here is of low quality.  You might as well be eating mcdonalds for a lot lower price and the same below par quality.  To make this an even worse experience,  I'm leaving with a funky taste in my mouth thanks to this crappy food!  Only giving this the extra star because of the good service.  I will admit I am a food snob but for lunch for two at $36 I should have high expectations and so should anyone else eating here.

Terrible food and lousy service! Food is of poor quality. Fries are very oily and disgusting (but they are "bottomless"). Well they are because they are are not edible. Me and my family all got sick. Restaurant Manager got very defensive when we called him. Instead of sympathizing or offering solutions, he was rude and useless. I can NOT in good faith recommend this place.
Was just served a bun with no burger. I don't even want to know who is working in the kitchen.

For being a burger place, I don't think the burgers are that great. I guess if you like a bunch of different toppings on your burger, you may like this place. For someone who only likes a plain cheeseburger, you can tell the quality of the meat is not very good. Neither my husband or I were impressed. Service was good, but we likely won't be back.

Ordered my burger plain, came with everything on it and my fries were ice cold. Waiter finally brought replacement burger after my family finished eating. Was there almost two hours on a Tuesday evening and a manager never apologized for making me eat alone. I will never go back to this location again. Film on the red plates and no straws given after we asked twice. The waiter was clearly over seated so I don't blame him, but my meal should have been brought to the attention of mgmt or taken off the bill.  Left in tears.

Red Robin serves up a pretty mean burger.  It can get a little crowded with family's/Kids sometimes, but the food is always solid and they have never ending Garlic Fries!  There are a lot of different burger options and I haven't been disappointed with any that I have tried so far.  I prefer it over the likes of Meatheads or Five Guy's.

Been here twice, but never again. The food is actually pretty good, thus 2 stars. However, service is awful. First visit we waited 40 minutes for our meal (just a couple of burgers).  Second time we waited 20 minutes to be acknowledged by a server.  And we had to flag her down at that.

Sigh. .. I wanted to like this place so much,  but  I was very disappointed in my burger. I've been seeing the commercials for their gourmet butgers, and  i just had to get one!! The so called $6.99 deal, was misleading. . 2 kid size patties.. And I couldn't get it MR??! but, if I ordered the bigger, single burger, I can have it cooked my way.. makes no sense.  I went with the Tavern... A cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato and a 1,000 dressing I didn't want.  I had it on a gluten free bun, which was burnt. First round of fries were cold and old..  Pomegranate  iced tea was just OK.. Very disappointed  for the money. $14 for a mediocre burger & iced tea.

Was in this restaurant on May 3rd 2015. Our visit began with a short 20 minute wait. Meanwhile we notice there were many tables waiting to be bussed, garbage debris on the floor, and the wait staff appeared to be stressed and chaotic. We were seated at a sticky table that was set in the main aisle and uncomfortably close to other tables.  In fact the back of our chairs were touching those of other patrons behind us.  Kyle our servicer,  was extrordinarily slow, and forgetful. We waited 15 before he took our drink order,  another 10 for water and maybe 10 more minutes for him to return to take our food order.  After waiting on our order 2 of the plates came to us which was not what was ordered.  The rest of the food and fries were cold. To get drinks refills was impossible,  certainly not worth the price especially since the cost of several were 4.95. I would have expected many refills - we were lucky to get 1 refill after the initial cup arrived. To get more fries seemed to be feat in itself.   Although it was busy and Kyle apologized for the slowness blaming it on the fact they were busy earlier,  he did nothing to improve our experience by speeding up his current service since the place had already begun to empty out after our drinks were delivered. We had to wait on napkins, forks and knives,  and by the time our second round of fries were delivered we were frustrated and swore to never return to this location again!  I'm sure Kyle works hard and waiting isn't an easy job but people tend to forget that a tip is NOT mandatory, as T.I.P. 's actual meaning is - To Insure Promptness. Kyle received a tip that reflected his service at our table - Pathetic!
Just had red robin and got the ghost burger, may i say very spicy but very delicious. I recomended this if you  like spicy things. Also got a nice cold stella to go with it.

Second time going to this location and  I will say this,  it was very different  experience.   then from when i went the first time.  It was very busy on this friday night which i understand ....but it seemed so messy also the bathrooms had run out of toilet paper, they where a mess.  I could not eat comfortable because of how cold it was in there I asked if it was always this cold and the waitress said they would  lower it . Seems like they highered it... The food was  not well done as we asked for it to be.  Under staffed  . This  may be the last time we go there...not impressed.  Shocked at the messiness of this restaurant.

Our experience was made because of Sal.  Best waiter I've ever had in my life. He went the extra mile to make sure my mother who has Alzheimer's was not only taken care of but also made her feel like the most important customer in the restaurant. Not enough can be said about him overall. One of a kind type person.

Today I had the Black & Bleu Burger, but I had it made with a lettuce wrap instead of a bun. Did you know they can make any sandwich using lettuce instead of a bun if you want? My server was Kristi and she did a nice job with the pace of my meal. The only complaint I had today was the amount of Sweet Potato Fries that came with my meal, a bit on the small side. I know you can always ask for more, but then you have to wait for them to come and it kind of throws off the timing of the whole meal. All in all it was a very good lunch that I had today..!
I love  this place they always treat you soooo nice like your are more than a stranger l!! Very good food!!!!!

Went in on a Wednesday night arounf 8 pm to order a chicken wrap and a few burgers with my family. The waitress was rushing us to order, did not ask if we wanted anything else after our burgers and beers. She was rushing us to finish our food and rushed us to sign the bill and tip her. Horrible waitress that rushed us through everything.... We may have been her last table for the night, but does not give an excuse to be a horrible waitress.

A big fan of Red Robin burgers in general, but this location doesn't stick to the same quality guidelines. The burgers feel overly greasy, the ingredients aren't very fresh. The location at Oak Brook Mall is quite good and I still go there to grab a burger, but I don't think I'll be visiting the Orland Park location again. Besides the low quality food, wait times can get crazy here. Service is at best average.

Scott our server was amazing very knowledgeable and friendly, will ask for him every time we come.  I love the option for bottomless salad being diabetic and now they ask how you want your egg cooked on the royal red robin

Enjoyed our experience here today. I had the whiskey BBQ chicken sandwich that was pretty great and my husband had the burger version was also quite good. Service was efficient but we did have to keep asking for fries, almost 5 times, because the servings they bring out are so small. Drinks are also extremely overpriced. A Coke for 2.79? That's a little nuts. They have also adapted to iPads for menus and payment system which is pretty efficient. Overall good was pretty good so I'm sure I'll be back.
Good family atmosphere. Kids love the pretzel bites. I really like the salted Carmel shake
Camp fire sauce. Bottomless fries. Tasty burgers. The bottomless root beer float is pretty sweet too. Most recent visit was solid as usual. Always leave full and cost is reasonable.

for a long time, i have been asked by my wife to go to the orland location. well we did and i can tell you there was no waiting, the service was excellent and the hamburgers were good, the garlic fries were rather dry (butter and garlic on top would have helped). the onion tower did not last, we love them. for some reason, the hamburgers seem larger and better tasting in california. regardless, is good to have this place in orland and i am sure we will visit again !
Great food here and I love there garlic fries. Just hate the long wait. Other than that everything is perfect.

I don't have too many experiences at Red Robins, so I can't compare this location to others. However, I can tell you this is a pretty good restaurant. I went on a Friday afternoon with my boyfriend and it was pretty empty, there were only us and one other customer. The waitresses didn't have much to do and sat around talking with the bartender, but our waitress was nice enough. The busboys were really nice though. They asked us about our new year and how our meal was. Typically, you don't have bus boys who are so friendly.  The burgers were pretty good. They have some unique combinations, but the classic looks pretty good too. I had the Whisky River BBQ burger. It was big and I ended up only eating half, but I could've eaten the whole thing. My boyfriend got the Southern Charm Burger and, unfortunately, he won the plate off and he got the better entrée. We also got bottomless fries with our food, which we didn't take advantage of since there was so much food, but nice to have.  Overall, this is a solid burger joint and I'd go again.

Poor service. Poor food. Very disappointing. Waitress forgot our salads. Took a long time to get burgers. They weren't hot when we finally got them, and had obviously been under the heat lamp for a while.  Burgers were less than mediocre. Mine was overcooked and had a strange taste. Fries were just okay.

i've never been to red robin before. but i saw this delicious sounding dessert they had called chocolate fruffles which is a chocolate brownie dipped in fudge and i KNEW i had to go asap. my sister asked me "do you just look up food on restaurant menus?" why yes, yes i do. this is average, hence the 3 stars, but the description for 2 stars fits it better, i've really experienced better.  when i go to a non fast food place, i expect a juicy burger. fresh, non frozen patty. what i got from here instead was a dry burger, almost like meat loaf with too many bread crumbs for filler. something you'd get from mcdonalds. my sister correctly said it tastes like a burger king burger. me and my sister went for their 2 for $15 special where you get an appetizer or dessert and 2 burgers. and the burgers they must use for that special must be some old shit they need to get rid of. i got their nacho crunch burger. so bland, all i could taste were the tomatoes. why can i only taste tomatoes on a nacho burger? it even looked like a burger king burger. the burger (i just said burger a lot) had no color when it was bit into, it was gray. it looked like a turkey burger. a really thin turkey burger. however their fried mushrooms and jalapenos are really really good. so is their purple freckin lemonade.  the dessert we got (chocolate fruffles (the whole point of going to the restaurant)) were ok. just ok i'd go back for their appetizers and drinks, but not for the burgers. which sort of goes against the purpose of the restaurant.
Love these burgers and chicken sandwiches and the desserts are to die for! We have always had a good experience in Red Robin and the food is yummy!

4 of us ate dinner here last night.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  Overall service was much slower than expected.  Quality of food was ok.  My biggest problem was the check total.   Between 4 of us we had 3 burgers.  One small appetizer and one of us had soda.   The other 3 drank watet.  My bill was over 50 bucks!  For only 3 entrees the cost was not worth what we paid.  Like I said food was ok.

Horrible service I ordered out and they messed up my order by not putting it in after 30 mins then they bring the wrong thing. Then over charge! So ridiculous never going back waited a total of two hours for an order that was still wrong when I got home!
The Black and Blue burger was delicious and our server was very friendly and efficient.

A fan of Red Robin but I will never go to this location again. The service is HORRIBLE! I went there with my family and it was a 45minute wait. That is okay, but when I went to the bathroom there were 7-8 tables open. Where is your staff to fill tables at on a Saturday at 5pm? Get it together!
Good food but something in it gave me and friend horrific indigestion. Go to Burger 21 for great taste and less belches..

No free Wifi here!  $2 to play a game on Ziosk??  Maybe that's why there's no free internet. Kids can't play games on their tablets or phone without wifi. The acoustics need to be tamed. It's hard to hold a conversation at the table. Great food though!!

I was on a field trip with a school group and the service was terrible. I was seated with a group of eleven people and we ordered straightaway. Our drinks didn't come for 30 minutes. Our teachers, though they sat after us, received their food within 40 minutes. The waitress repeatedly came to refill our drinks while we sat there waiting, and we didn't have napkins. I even saw a mom and her son leave because their food was not being served. We ended up getting our food an HOUR AND A HALF after sitting down. I spoke to some people who were in other groups and they were served within fifteen minutes. The manager came out to tell us they were slow because of the so many orders. But they could have served the platters as they made them one after the other, instead of choosing to wait until all of them were made before bringing them out. In the end, my group was too angry to actually enjoy the food.  Will definetely not be going back at all, terrible service.

Best experience i have had.Although I waited longer than expected, because there was a mess up with the orders in the kitchen, the manage was very respectful, apologetic & paid for our $42 dollar bill .Very nice wait staff (Troy) and great burgers!

We love coming to this location, the food is always delicious and the service is excellent. Refills right away and a lot of fries! On weekends there might be a little wait time but it's usually around 10 min or less so it's not a big deal.

Too bad but this place just keeps tripping over its own feet. Went for a burger and a beer last night and had the exact same experience we've had every time...just so-so food and service. The burgers are ok, but nothing special (Five Guys are better); service is where I think they make their money because they never seem to have enough wait staff - maybe they will learn they cannot save their way into prosperity - service was slow and spotty especially with the fries (see below); on the good side they have a nice selection of beer with many on draft...so this is their bright spot. Now the fries. The schtik of Red Robin is (1) Gourmet burgers (which means they can put nearly anything you want on a fair burger for $10 and up) and (2) bottomless or endless French fries (not even close). For the second time when we were there the bottomless fries are only in name. You get fries with your burger and are supposed to get as many more as you want...but you won't see anyone come by and ask if you want more until you are on your last bite of hamburger. You'd think they live and die off French fry sales. Why couldn't they just have one of the wait staff come around to the tables with a big basket of fries topping off everyone who had fries? Why do they wait so long to come ask? And when you do ask you wait another ten minutes for them to come out...by the time they do you are sorry you asked. Really...just have a person cruising the dining room with fries to top everyone off...Quit waiting for people to beg for more. So their schtik is lost on me...loses me as a customer too.  In all fairness, the manager did make the rounds of the room also...and also did so as we were finished. We saw our waitress maybe three times...took the order (after we cooled our heels for awhile)...checked in right after (hadn't even taken a bite yet)...and told us how to check ourselves out. We were never offered any dessert...never offered another beer...and were only offered more fries as they were ready to clean the table off...nothing. To add to the lack of staffing, they now have machines on each table so you can check yourself out...swiping your card and printing out your own receipt. Their drive to cut staff makes this a people unfriendly place. Might as well make your own hamburger at home.

If you ever eat in the bar area-  you will find that the bartender is made to wait on tables, wait on people at the bar, make shakes, make drinks, and go to the kitchen to get waters.   Thus- you will not get good service, as the poor bartender is given way too many duties to perform.  I witnessed the bartender doing everything, while other employees and managers were standing around doing nothing and talking.   How about helping her out?   If you eat in the main dining room, it's like Chuck E. Cheese in there............if you eat in the bar area, you will get poor service.   I saw people waiting for their check forever, got disgusted and just walked out.  Where is the manager??  We have talked to the manager twice in person about this- with no help or changes- we have thus removed Red Robin from our list of places to eat.
Nice place. Good food and service. Amazing choice of burgers so you can have it your way. It's hard to beat a great burger and a cold beer!!
Very good big and juicy burger with very nice service.

I am giving them one stars,but I would rather give them no stars, not for the food, not for the service, but the condition of the restaurant itself is in. If you are in anyway handicapped, read on. If you have trouble walking, read on. If you just walk, read on. Most of the restaurant's floors are a tiled marble or slate or some kind of stone whether man made or natural. It is red and it is very slippery. I do not know if it is from the grease that is normally associated with restaurants or because of the air conditioning that there was condensation on the floor, or more likely, a combination of both. I have to use a cane to help me walk,  I am in the middle of getting both my knees replaced. The cane would not hold its gripe on the floor and kept sliding. I had to walk and hold onto the chairs, unoccupied tables, anything to stabilize me.  I nearly fell. Another patron, a woman, said that she also almost slipped if she hadn't gripped the booth divider. She complained but nothing was done. They had one warning sign out, the ones that you use for a wet floor, that was you only warning. A mop and some grease cutting detergent is not going to clean it. I worked in the restaurant industry for 5 years and have had to clean floors using a scrubbing machines to get the grease off. I would suggest that they have their floors cleaned regularly by an outside company or by a scrubber. One of these days someone is going to fall and they are going to have a lawsuit on their hands.  As for the food I would rate that 3 stars. The crab burger is good considering that it is not fresh like on the east or west coasts. We also had the fish and chips and chicken platter.  If management of Red Robin in Orland Park read the reviews, I hope that they take this as a warning and do something before an accident happens.

I ordered the nachos as the appetizer and sent them back because it was literally a plate of chips with very little ingredients on it.  For 10 bucks I'd expect at least some melted cheese on there. Service was decent.

I've been to Red Robin many times, both food and service are great. The burgers were at the right temperature everything I ordered. Appetizers and entrée comes to the table at the timely Manny. The wait staffs were polite and seem very happy to work there which make a huge impact to the restaurant moral. I will definitely go back for more.

So just to get to the point, this place is getting worst each time I return. The last time I went about 6 weeks ago, I noticed that they pretty much sit families with kids on the south side of the restaurant away from the bar. So if you get seated on that side you have to deal with you know the typical.   On the bar side there's only about 4 booths and the rest of the tables are small with uncomfortable bar like stools whereas your feet are dangling throughout your meal. During that same visit,  I had to request clean silverware from my waitress because they were noticeably unclean. On my next visit on Saturday Sept. 3, the waitress placed my silverware on the table and the person I was with noticed that a food particle fell off the silverware onto the table. Upon inspection of the silverware we noticed that one of the forks was covered in ketchup  and appeared as if it had been dipped directly into the bottle.  Then we noticed that many particles were floating in one glass of water and the other had food particles stuck on the inside of the glass. Perfect way to get food poisoning or something else.  Help yourself!!    I don't believe in the 3 second rule.
Great service and satisfying grub! The parmesan herb fries were scrumptious and the shroom burger was juicy and tasty.
One of my favorite places to eat. Banzai burger with a veggie patty and egg makes you want to go back!
The food is good. Prices are decent but the bartender sucks. Do not order a mojito or a margarita. I sent my drinks back to get fixed, and they came back tasting the same - nothing but lime juice

Horrible service the night that I went. Our server took forever to serve us, never refilled our drinks and pretty much neglected us. When we finally received our food it was horrible, I've had better burgers at Burger King. Wish I hadn't wasted my money on this meal.
Drunk waitstaff.  Loud and distracting.  "If I get fired for this..." Food was good, but uncomfortable dining experience.

I like the location. It's clean and the waiter is attentive without being extra. I got the burnin' love burger and bottomless fries. I also had the spinach dip, which was great. I love that thry have fresh onions on the top. If you don't like onions just ask for them without it and I'm sure they will comply. We spent a lot of time here and nobody rushed us out. We were talking for hours, no problem. I will be back.

On Monday, December26th, my friends, my son and I visited your restaurant. This was to be my first time at the restaurant and I was admittedly very excited. I have tried to visit multiple times but the lines were too long. On this day, I was told that the wait time would be approximately 25 minutes. And while this was not idea, I was willing to wait because I was with a friend who generally rants and raves about this restaurant. After 40 minutes after giving our names, I was told that we would be next. Finally after almost 50 minutes we were seated. This was a frustrating experience but I understand that the wait time generally depends on the leisure of the patrons. After being seated, we were greeted by a pleasant waiter who promptly took our order. We ordered several blue moons that took almost 15 minutes to come. I was then told that if I wanted an orange in it, it would take at least another 10 so we agreed to drink the drink with out its signature garnish. After waiting 20 more minutes, our waiter told us that the kitchen had been experiencing some problems all day and the ticket time was at least 45 minutes. We asked to speak to the manager 3 times before he came to our table to talk to us. When we finally got our food at least 50 minutes after being seated, it was ice cold. I was floored and very angry because at this time, we had waited almost 2 hours for food that was freezing cold. I should have known this would be an issue because multiple patrons around us were complaining and sending food back to the kitchen. The lady across from me sent he burger back and it did not return for at least 20 minutes. I was not prepared to experience the same torture on my empty stomach, plus my 4 year old was completely famished and starting to wine in anguish. We ended up leaving the restaurant with out eating anything and wasting 2 hours on a perfectly good day in a restaurant that was obviously mismanaged, understaffed and dishonest. In the future, it would be more appropriate to 1). Give a correct wait time so that patrons can make an educated decision about how long they want to wait, 2) Let people know upfront that there are issues in the kitchen and that the ticket time is exceeding 45 minutes 3) Better attend to your guests by at least providing the necessary garnishes for their drinks. I was really looking forward to my Red Robin experience and to say I was disappointed would be an understatement.  Thank you for your time JM Case #00799769

Poor quality food that has gone down over the years. I was on staff here for the opening of this restaurant back in 2008 and the management took great pride in the restaurant. Hard to say the same now. Food was awful and the ladies bathroom was filthy. Will not be going back.

Food was ok, every one around us was messed up manger did not really seem to care. Service is about the worst you can get lady at front end did not even wanna check us in, when you walk in most days there is no one at the check in counter and you are standing there wondering what to do. Tonight was no different. Sitting near kitchen hearing a waiter complain how much he hates working here. Am I at mcdonalds or red Robbin yikes!!

Decent burger, but this is one of the dirtiest restaurants I've been in.  Floor is really funky, feet are slipping on something.  Wasn't this way a few years ago.  Maybe just a bad night. Also very, very slooooow service

This place was hugely popular when it first opened - waiting lines of well over an hour. It's quieted down quite a bit now, probably because of the prices. It is pretty expensive for a burger and fries. Could probably get them a lot cheaper elsewhere. But the combinations of burger, sauces, and cheese are imaginative and they do offer unlimited fries.

We had a great meal at this Red Robin restaurant today.  But what made it really special was our waitress, Alicia.  She was effect ant, professional and very personable.  Thanks Red Robon for the good food and for having a great waitress like Alicia..

This was probably the most terrible service I've had this year. I was seated in the bar area around 3pm and served by a waitress named Kristy. Kristy was very short, rude, and she barley made any eye contact or engage in conversation. It took her quite a while to check on our table after our food was served. I wouldn't recommend to any of my friends or family to come to this particular Red Robbins in Orland Park.

One of the best burger/family restaurants, very kid friendly but im sure everyone knows what this place is but this certain location is fantastic, excellent service, I've been there dozens of times with my kids and always had service with a smile every single time. Even when its crowded they manage to seat you with a very minimum wait. When my kids ask me to go back there you know it's gotta be good with good service to boot

This is the first Red Robin I've been to, and it wasn't the greatest experience. The saying is, if the place is crowded and the lines are long it must be because the place is great. Ehh, not so much here. It's because the service is sloooow and good luck on getting your server back after you received your menu. I almost wanted to get up and leave in between that time because they take so long. This is probably why the parking is packed and the lines are long! People are waiting for the menu. When we finally ordered the food I assumed it'll be a long wait but it was pretty average time. BUT, when do get your food, try to think of EVERYTHING you need and ask them for it. Even for the bottomless fries you haven't dived into yet. If "your thing" is bottomless fries then it should truly feel that way. It's almost like you're bothering them for asking when that is what I paid for. The same with dipping sauces; it's like pulling teeth to get this simple stuff. I've gone to another location and it was almost the same experience but not as bad. I love the food and the concept but the service could potentially push me away from this place.

Update: After speaking to the manager, Brittany, I am totally impressed with the customer service I received. She went above and beyond to fix my situation and I sincerely appreciate that. Due to my positive interaction with Brittany I will be frequenting Red Robin much more often. It's often difficult to own up to mistakes so I commend Brittany for being so honest and sincere. This is one of the best displays of customer service I have ever received from management. Thank you, Brittany!

Called them to see when dp they seat there last customer to dine in because the time was 920 and they close at 10 the lady in the phone said that they seat till 10 oclock so me and my husband decided to go in when we got there everyone looked at us like they were going to die then when we sat down service sucked we didn't see are server only when we ordered and when our food arrived it was so cold which I don't know how if we were the only customers in the restaurant worst service ever

My family had not eaten at the Red Robin in Orland Park, IL for over a year, was disappointed in our experience.  We arrived about 3:45pm, it was not super busy.   We ordered nachos for an appetizer.  The chips tasted stale and the chili only covered about a third of the top of the chips.  Then I saw a few pieces of macaroni and cheese on the nachos...yuck.  Told my family to stop eating it.  It took awhile for the waitress to come back our way.  Told her what the problem was.  She asked if we wanted another plate of nachos, our dinner was on the way from the kitchen.  Nope.  Waitress just walked off.  I had ordered a wedge salad.  Someone other than our waitress brought our dinner, was polite, asked if there was any else we needed.  Yes, my wedge salad.  Our burgers were good, however, received my wedge salad at the end of the meal.  The nachos should've been removed from the bill.  Will not be eating at this restaurant again.

Terrible service/staff. Waitress ignored us. Our food was serviceable. The worst thing was the busboy adjusting his socks and picking his feet in the dining room and then touched the glasses. What a health hazard. Called the manager on the way home.  He was more concerned about the poor service then the health violation.  Never will I go back to this place.
The food was below average, didn't put enough blue cheese on my blue cheese burger which really turned me off. We paid almost $50 for 2 burgers and fries. Over priced and bad quality of food.
D I S G U S T I N G ... cheese fries are fries with wax American cheese on top. Raw broccoli, undercooked and over spiced chicken. Terrible service.

Visited this Red Robin today for a late lunch about 1:30 pm. There were lots of little kids in there as usual screaming and yelling. But that's OK because if you do not have little kids you can sit in the bar area and it's a bit more quite in there. Service was good and food was ok. Son said his bacon cheeseburger was not that great. I did taste a fry and it was not hot. Wife and I  ordered Salads with the Whiskey BBQ chicken and avocado. My chicken was OK but wife did not like it. She ate a small portion and was just going to leave the rest but I had her wrap it so that I could try it later. No desert today. Food here use to be much better a couple years ago. The place is always busy though as mom's and dad's love bringing in the kids there to eat while they enjoy a cocktail or 2.

07/14/2017 I placed my order online with specific instructions including "extra fries".  Unfortunately, due to a past experience I now check my order before I leave the restaurant.  Needless to say I was disappointed in the quality of food.  The bun was not "grilled", the sauce on both burgers were a thin spread, the Black & Bleu Burger did not grilled onions nor the mushroom as expressed in the description, and the other did not include the extra fries...If the intent was to give me extra fries I wold hate to see how many fries I would have received if I did not ask!  I reminded the cashier Hannah that my order specifically indicated extra fries for both orders and that the burgers looked "Sorry".  Without much of a response, Hannah informed me that she would place an additional order for extra fries.... It is unexceptable that whomever packed my order actually deemed it of quality/acceptable.  Although my order is "To-Go" I do not want to make it home only to be disappointed that a restaurant located in my own neighborhood serves such poor quality of food!  Orland Park is known as the "To-Go" neighborhood for many people in the surrounding neighborhoods.  To know that Red Robin Orland Park is respresenting Orland Park in such a manner is shameful.  It's unfortunate that I no longer want to return to the Orland Park location and now have to seek another "Gourmet" burger restaurant in my own area.   Please improve your standards...or re-locate.
Love the burger with the fried egg! It's amazing. I don't come here often but when I do I always enjoy it.

This is one of our go-to spots when we're in the Orland area.  It may not be the fanciest joint in the world, but the food is always good and the servers are always pleasant.  If you are a non-meat eater, try the new veggie burger on the menu, it was awesome!

Wings. Burgers. Beer.  Strawberry lemonade with free refills and real strawberries! This place has something for everyone, beef burgers, chicken sandwiches (grilled and fried), fish sandwiches (grilled and fried), turkey patty or veggie patty. Plus bottomless fries. Seriously worth every penny.

Not sure where to start. Came in for a burger already knew what I wanted a burger and a veggie burger. My burger was good and the otner persons burger not so good. Long wait for the food to come out waitress said she is super busy and apologized for the wait so the manager took our order anyway veggie burger looked very sad with very few toppings on there so we told the waitress and again she apologized took it back and told us they will re do it. We just wanted more things on there like the menu states. After another 30 min of waiting it came out still looking sad i was already done with mine and she ate hers. Overall the food wasnt so good the waiting time was horrible the place was extra dirty and the furniture looks pretty beat up. The only person that seemed to care was our waitress even tho everything was super slow. Looking at the reviews and the ratings for all red robin is sad if they dont change their service this chain will probably shut down in the near future.

Honestly this experience has been terrible. We waited over 1 hour for our meals to come to the table and when it finally arrived it was cold. Burgers were very dry fries were extra soggy cold and waitress was know where to be found. By far the worst experience I have ever encountered in any restaurant chain. It was what it seemed a very slow night which would give no reason for this type of service. I wish my $95 donation goes towards employee training. I recommend portillos of five guys for a much better tasting fresh burger.

I am beyond furious right now. I just left Red Robin without even ordering! We got seated and waited... and waited... and waited. No one came to acknowledge our existence. The family in the booth next to us that got seated after us already ordered their drinks and received them and then started to order their food. Before we were even acknowledged. So we left and now I'm hungry and pissed.

I have been eating here regularly for over 5 years and they used to have great servers and seemed to have good management. Last week I called in a to go order and they joked around in the phone and then completely messed up my order! I called three times since then trying to have them fix it and they still haven't given me the right food or a refund. Seems like you have to be an angry customer to get their attention. What a shame!

This is probably my favorite restaurant in the last 3 months of my life, second to only a few others. It has a phenomenal staff who consider me one of their 'own'. The fact that I can walk in with only a small amount on my debit card yet walk out feeing full, satisfied, and content with my carton of refilled fries (bottomless refills!) is of utmost importance to me. It is one of a kind and I TOTALLY dig it. Thanks.

Poor service but the food is good. It's not even busy and they can't even greet me within X amount of seconds of approaching the bar or get my food ready on time. The hostess tells me to go to the bar the manager tells me the hostess is getting me my food. Come on get your communication on the same page.

Wow. Flat out - the other reviews were right! Quite possibly the worst Red Robin I've been to. Maybe even one of the worst restaurants I've been to, as well.  For starters, let's agree most adults go here for the kids. Am I right? Kids love this place. Well, even ours were disappointed. 4 kids, 3 adults visit for dinner. Walk in, no one else is in the lobby, we see empty (albeit dirty tables everywhere), and are quoted 20 minutes. (Rudely, I might add. 2 people and it took some back and forth from them to come to this 20 Minute guesstimation). Anyway, it took closer to 6 minutes for our table. A smaller group came in after us and did get a table quickly.  Our server brusquely introduced herself and I kid you not, robotically took orders. No inflection. No banter. It was "You?" "Thank you." "You?@ "Thank you." So we wait. Too long. We hear servers and cooks yelling at each other. Apparently, according to one server, you practically have to kill someone to get garlic fries in the window. Pretty sure I hear an f-bomb, as well, which is always awesome in a family restaurant with an open kitchen.  Then the orders come out. Well, kinda. Kids meal with a wrong side item, adult meal with the wrong side item, side of ranch missing, my meal COMPLETELY MISSING. Had to remind the server what it was. Pretty sure it was never entered, as I then had to wait another 10 minutes for the Southern Charm burger and cole slaw. (Which, not so charming after all. Although cooked to temp, it was oozing in too much bbq sauce and the toppings weren't even crunchy at that point. So much sauce, even the presentation was lacking and t came out with sauce on the top of the bun! Like someone's hand had gotten in it!) My cole slaw tasted good, but was presented oddly. It looked like it was pre-scooped into the dish and was kinda wilty and flat on top.  Also at our table was a teriyaki Chicken Sandwich, on lettuce instead of a bun, that fell apart it was so saucy.   One of the adults had a plain burger with fruit salad. It was the weirdest fruit salad ever. Missing strawberries (so not really a freckled salad after all) and oozing in juice. Soaked. Even the apples had turned a kinda pinkish juicy color. Our server did bring more servings of bottomless fries and Mac and cheese for the kids. Of the 3 refills, one of the bowls of Mac was cold. Flat out, when the child complained and for some reason I didn't take her word for it (crazy I didn't assume t was wrong, right?), I actually stuck my finger in the bowl. Cold. Awesome. Told the server, no "I'm sorry" or "Wow, let me fix that for you." She literally looked at us and said "Ok." Trust me, we laughed about this in disbelief the minute she walked away. One of the kids also ordered a second helping of bottomless salad. Wound up getting an adult side salad with tomatoes on it. Of all places, Red Robin, who specializes in reeling in the kids, should know tomatoes is a no-no.  Soon after this, we heard another patron yelling at the manager. Something about waiting too long for a table and looking around and it was empty. Honestly, one of us should have walked over to her and told her to just go somewhere else - save her sanity and her money.  Our server did bring out complimentary birthday sundaes to all the kids as an apology. Gotta say, would have preferred a comped check instead of that.  I'm giving this location 2 Stars out of 5 simply because I reserve 1 Star for places that make me sick or have health violations. Save for the fact that there was no food poisoning involved, this would have been a 1. Seriously. That. Bad.

Me and my family have visited this location before, each time was okay, but this time was GREAt. Our waiter was named Scottie, he was wonderful. very knowledgeable of the menu and any questions we asked he knew the answer to. He is an asset to The Red Robin establishment. If you get a chance to visit this location ask for him.
